page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: Although the village is situated on a very busy road linking the east coast ports with the M1 and Birmingham complex, it has a very limited bus service linking Rugby (14 miles) and Market Harborough (4 miles). Apart from buses taking mainly school children morning and afternoon, there are very few buses in each direction daily; the last one returning from Market Harborough at 5.10 p.m. About 30 people say they use the bus regularly, which might be daily for work or weekly for shopping. It therefore isn't surprising that there are about 100 cars and vans in the village plus about 50 bicycles, 11 motor bikes, a tandem, a tricycle and a moped. About 50 out of the 80 houses have a garage and 9 cars regularly park overnight on the Village Hall car park.
